intro: Phyla nodiflora var. texensis, commonly known as Texas starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and along roadsides. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a common weed in many regions.
